title: Chiefs fight back to beat Texans and reach AFC Championship game
description: The Kansas City Chiefs stage a thrilling comeback from 24-0 down to beat the Houston Texans 51-31 and advance to the AFC Championship game.

title: Masters 2020: Best shots as Carter halts Selby comeback
description: Watch some of the best moments as Ali Carter sees off the challenge of three-time Masters winner Mark Selby to progress to the quarter-finals

title: Who buzzed around Goodison like an Everton icon? Garth Crooks' team of the week
description: Which Chelsea youngster finally makes the cut? And which Everton midfielder buzzed around Goodison Park? Find out in Garth Crooks' team of the week.

title: Newspaper headlines: Harry 'in turmoil' and 'royal soap Oprah'
description: Monday's front pages are dominated by speculation about the meeting between senior royals at Sandringham.

title: Sheffield shooting: Boy, 12, injured as shots fired from car
description: The child was in a group gathered on a road in Sheffield when a gunman opened fire from a car.

title: Australia fires: Aboriginal planners say the bush 'needs to burn'
description: What would happen if Australia followed the ancient bushfire management practices of Aboriginal people?

title: Roger Scruton: Conservative thinker dies at 75
description: The philosopher, who died from cancer, is hailed as "the greatest conservative of our age".

title: Aston Villa 1-6 Manchester City: Pep Guardiola praises Sergio Aguero's 'incredible achievement'
description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola congratulates striker Sergio Aguero on becoming the highest overseas goalscorer in Premier League history after scoring his 12th career hat-trick.

title: Aston Villa 1-6 Manchester City: Sergio Aguero becomes highest overseas scorer in Premier League history
description: Manchester City produce a devastating goalscoring performance to leave Aston Villa in the Premier League relegation zone.

title: WSL: Arsenal loanee Mitchell scores for Spurs & other great goals
description: Watch four great goals from this weekend's Women's Super League, including Arsenal loanee Emma Mitchell scoring for Tottenham.

title: Ding suffers shock defeat by Perry in Masters first round
description: UK Champion Ding Junhui is beaten 6-3 by Joe Perry in the first round of the Masters at Alexandra Palace.

title: Iran plane downing: Second day of protests turns up heat on leaders
description: There are calls for senior officials to be dismissed after a passenger jet was mistakenly shot down.

title: Philippines volcano: Thousands evacuated as Taal spews ash
description: Some 8,000 people are ordered to leave their homes after the Taal volcano spews a giant cloud of ash.

title: Bournemouth 0-3 Watford: Hornets win to move out of relegation zone
description: Watford climb above Bournemouth and out of the bottom three for the first time this season with a convincing victory over the Cherries.

title: Iran's only female Olympic medallist defects condemning country's oppression of women
description: Kimia Alizadeh, a taekwondo bronze medallist, says authorities used her success as a propaganda tool.

title: Can Australia's PM Scott Morrison recover from the fires?
description: Since September, bushfires have killed at least 28 people and destroyed thousands of homes.

title: Iran plane crash: Britain condemns Tehran's arrest of UK ambassador
description: Iran says he was arrested "as an unknown foreigner in an illegal gathering", but released soon afterwards.

title: Department store Beales warns of collapse risk
description: Beales says 22 stores and 1,000 jobs are at risk if it cannot find a buyer.

title: Canada nuclear plant: Alert about incident sent in error
description: Officials demand answers after people were warned of an incident at the Pickering power plant.

title: Pringles lorry fire closes M1 slip road in Derbyshire
description: The HGV driver was unhurt and managed to escape the blaze near junction 25.

title: Root misses training through illness as Buttler apologises for swearing
description: England captain Joe Root misses Sunday's practice for the third Test against South Africa with a stomach upset.

title: Australia bushfires: The race to save animal casualties
description: Wildfires have wreaked devastation to wildlife on Australia's third largest island.

title: Queen and Prince Harry to hold talks over Sussexes' future
description: Senior royals will meet at Sandringham on Monday to discuss Prince Harry and Meghan's future.

title: Ski Sunday: Chemmy Alcott skies at Copenhill
description: Former Olympic skier Chemmy Alcott tests out Copenhill, a ski slope on top of a power plant in the latest episode of Ski Sunday.

title: Labour leadership contenders make final pitches
description: The candidates need 22 nominations to make it onto the ballot paper to replace Jeremy Corbyn.

title: Federer responds to climate change critics over Credit Suisse links
description: Campaigners including Greta Thunberg want Federer to end a sponsorship deal with Credit Suisse.

title: Brexit: EU 'won't be rushed' on trade deal, says Simon Coveney
description: Ireland's deputy PM says talks are likely to take longer than Boris Johnson's end of 2020 deadline.

title: Tributes pour in as Oman mourns Sultan Qaboos
description: A condolence ceremony is being held as the country remembers Sultan Qaboos who died aged 79.

title: Tennessee Titans 28-12 Baltimore Ravens: Derrick Henry's jump-pass touchdown
description: Running back Derrick Henry stuns the Baltimore Ravens defence with a jump-pass touchdown pass as the Tennessee Titans beat the AFC top seeds 28-12 in the NFL divisional play-offs.

title: Ben Wallace: UK 'must be prepared to fight wars without US'
description: The Defence Secretary says fears the US will withdraw from international leadership "keep me awake".

title: Iran plane crash: Why this could be a watershed moment
description: Anger at the government's response could lead to further unrest ahead of elections, an expert says.

title: 'Relieved' Williams wins first title in three years
description: Serena Williams claims her first title in three years and first since becoming a mother with victory over Jessica Pegula at the Auckland Classic.

title: Cheryl Grimmer: Missing toddler police offer A$1m reward
description: Three-year-old Cheryl Grimmer, from Bristol, disappeared from an Australian beach in 1970.

title: Centenary of 'vital' Scott Polar Research Institute, Cambridge
description: The Cambridge University institute still "inspires the next generations of polar researchers".

title: Parkinson's disease: Maura Ward's adventures around the globe
description: Maura Ward, 70, says Parkinson's disease won't stop her from travelling around the world.

title: Australia fires: PM admits mistakes in handling of crisis
description: Scott Morrison responds to criticism over the bushfires, proposing an inquiry into the crisis.

title: Malta: Robert Abela elected new PM after crisis over journalist's murder
description: Robert Abela is the new Labour Party leader, after Joseph Muscat resigned over a journalist's murder.

title: Newspaper headlines: William's 'sadness' as Queen calls royal 'summit'
description: The Queen's family meeting at Sandringham on Monday is the focus for Sunday's front pages.

title: Love Island: Inside the new villa in South Africa
description: Newsbeat's Roisin Hastie has a sneak peek at the luxurious pad in Cape Town.

title: The GP practice where patients can share appointments
description: Group sessions allow more GP time and the chance to meet others with the same illness, advocates say.

title: Brenda Blethyn's Vera: More than a scruffy mac and hat
description: The star of the popular detective series on how she has learned to love her dogged, scruffy sleuth.

title: National Trust turns 125: Wales' role in charity's history
description: A gorse-covered hillside in Gwynedd was the first place taken on by the charity.

title: 'I've paid $250,000 for a ticket into space'
description: Space tourism is set to take off in 2020 as firms offering tickets get ready for the final countdown.

title: Researchers: Are we on the cusp of an ‘AI winter’?
description: AI researchers admit that the hype around AI may be cooling off once again.

title: Maxence Melo's Jamii Forums: Tanzania’s 'accidental journalist'
description: Maxence Melo, the online freedom champion in Tanzania, is apprehensive of what might happen in an election year.

title: John Baldessari: The artist who cremated his own paintings
description: John Baldessari, who touched the art world with his irreverent humour, has died at the age of 88.

title: Night rider: 21 years sleeping on a London bus
description: When Sunny's asylum application was refused, he took refuge overnight on London's buses - for two decades.

title: LGBT armed forces ban: 'How far we've come'
description: Two decades after the ban on gay people serving in the armed forces ended, three people share their stories.

title: The deadly 'ghost gear' which haunts seas and coastlines
description: Tonnes of fishing equipment are lost or abandoned every year, posing a risk to wildlife at sea and on shore.
